Package: grails.plugins.rest.client

[Groovy] Class RequestCustomizer

    • grails.plugins.rest.client.RequestCustomizer

    • Core of the DSL for building REST requests

      Authors:
      Graeme Rocher
      Since:
      1.0

      • Method Detail

        • RequestCustomizer accept(java.lang.String... contentTypes)

          Sets the Accept HTTP header to the given value. Example: 

          
 restBuilder.get("http://..") {
      accept "application/xml"
 }
          Parameters:
          contentTypes - The content types
          Returns:
          The customizer

        • RequestCustomizer accept(java.lang.Class responseType, java.lang.String... contentTypes)

          Sets the Accept HTTP header to the given value. Example: 

          
 restBuilder.get("http://..") {
      accept XML
 }
          Parameters:
          responseType - The expected response type
          contentTypes - The content types
          Returns:
          The customizer

        • RequestCustomizer auth(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)

          Used to configure BASIC authentication. Example: 

          
 builder.put("http://..") {
      auth "myuser", "mypassword"
 }
          Parameters:
          username - The username
          password - The password
          Returns:
          The customizer

        • RequestCustomizer auth(java.lang.String accessToken)

          Sets the Authorization HTTP header to the given value. Used typically to pass OAuth access tokens. 

          
 builder.put("http://..") {
      auth myToken
 }
          Parameters:
          accessToken - The access token
          Returns:
          The customizer

        • RequestCustomizer body(java.lang.Object content)

          Sets the body of the request to the given argument. Note that if you argument is not convertable to a message body an exception will be thrown. You can register new converters using restBuilder.restTemplate.getMessageConverters().add(..)

          Parameters:
          content - The body content
          Returns:
          This customizer

        • RequestCustomizer contentType(java.lang.String contentType)

          Sets the Content-Type HTTP header to the given value. Example: 

          
 restBuilder.put("http://..") {
      contentType "application/xml"
 }
          Parameters:
          contentType - The content type
          Returns:
          The customizer

        • org.springframework.http.HttpEntity createEntity()

        • RequestCustomizer header(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)

          Sets an HTTP header to the given name and value. Example: 

          
 restBuilder.get("http://..") {
      header "Accept", "text/xml"
 }
          Parameters:
          name - The name of the header
          value - The value of the header
          Returns:
          The customizer

        • RequestCustomizer json(@groovy.lang.DelegatesTo(JSONBuilder) groovy.lang.Closure callable)

          Sets the body of the request to the JSON defined by the closure. The closure uses JSONBuilder to product a JSON object. Example: 

          
 restBuilder.put("http://..") {
     json {
        name = "test-group"
        description = "A temporary test group"
     }
 }
          Parameters:
          callable - The callable closure
          Returns:
          This customizer

        • RequestCustomizer json(grails.converters.JSON json)

          Sets the body of the request to the passed JSON

          Parameters:
          json - The JSON object
          Returns:
          this customizer

        • RequestCustomizer json(org.grails.web.json.JSONElement json)

          Sets the body of the request to the passed JSON

          Parameters:
          json - The JSON object
          Returns:
          this customizer

        • RequestCustomizer json(java.lang.String json)

          Sets the body of the request to the passed JSON string

          Parameters:
          json - The JSON object
          Returns:
          this customizer

        • RequestCustomizer json(java.lang.Object object)

          Converts the given object to JSON and sets the body to the converted JSON object

          Parameters:
          object - The object to convert to JSON
          Returns:
          this customizer

        • void setProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object value)

          Sets multipart values within the request body

          Parameters:
          name - The name of the multipart
          value - The value of the multipart

        • RequestCustomizer urlVariables(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object> variables)

          Configures any variables used in the case of a templated URL. Example: 

          
 restBuilder.get("http://../book/{id}") {
      urlVariables id:1
 }
          Parameters:
          variables - The URL variables
          Returns:

        • RequestCustomizer xml(@groovy.lang.DelegatesTo(StreamingMarkupBuilder) groovy.lang.Closure closure)

          Sets the body of the request to the XML defined by the closure. Uses groovy.xml.StreamingMarkupBuilder to produce the XML

          Parameters:
          closure - The closure that defines the XML
          Returns:
          This customizer

        • RequestCustomizer xml(grails.converters.XML xml)

          Sets the body of the request to the XML converter argument.

          Parameters:
          xml - The XML to be used as the body of the request
          Returns:
          This customizer

        • RequestCustomizer xml(java.lang.String xml)

          Sets the body of the request to the XML string argument.

          Parameters:
          xml - The XML to be used as the body of the request
          Returns:
          This customizer

        • RequestCustomizer xml(groovy.util.slurpersupport.GPathResult xml)

          Sets the body of the request to the XML GPathResult argument.

          Parameters:
          xml - The XML to be used as the body of the request
          Returns:
          This customizer

        • RequestCustomizer xml(java.lang.Object object)

          Converts the given object to XML using Grails' converters and sets the XML as the body of the request

          Parameters:
          object - The object
          Returns:
          This customizer
